resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
fsaintjacques commented on pull request #3464: ARROW-4336: Change the default BUILD_WARNING_LEVEL to CHECKIN
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3464
 
 
   The goal of this change is to minimize the time waiting at CI for
   any warning errors. The default was PRODUCTION.
   
   This also does a minor cleanup of some C++ files such that compilation
   succeeds in `EVERYTHING` compile mode.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #3464: ARROW-4336: Change the default BUILD_WARNING_LEVEL to CHECKIN
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3464#issuecomment-456857009
 
 
   I'm kind of -0.5 on this. Having this on by default is going to mean more broken builds out of the box
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #3464: ARROW-4336: Change the default BUILD_WARNING_LEVEL to CHECKIN
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3464#issuecomment-456952888
 
 
   @fsaintjacques can you split the code changes that fix EVERYTHING warnings into a separate patch? I think it makes most sense to decouple those changes from the discussion about what should be the default arguments
   
   In general we have been changing the defaults steadily away from contributor-optimized defaults (like ARROW_BUILD_TESTS used to be "on" by default) toward user-optimized defaults. This reflects that many more people are using the project as a library instead of contributing to it. 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

xhochy commented on issue #3464: ARROW-4336: Change the default BUILD_WARNING_LEVEL to CHECKIN
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3464#issuecomment-457204115
 
 
   Having this as a default will annoy a lot of packagers, thus I'm also -0.5. We should have this CMake option in the developer docs as part of the default `cmake` calls.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on issue #3464: ARROW-4336: Change the default BUILD_WARNING_LEVEL to CHECKIN
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3464#issuecomment-457212141
 
 
   I'll separate the warning fixes into another patch. 
   
   Counter-proposal that could satisfy everyone. Make `CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE` the default? This will make it user-optimized by default while preserving the warning level to minimum (and no -werror). As soon as someone switches to `DEBUG`, it'll also go into `CHECKIN` unless specified otherwise.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

xhochy commented on issue #3464: ARROW-4336: Change the default BUILD_WARNING_LEVEL to CHECKIN
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3464#issuecomment-457226783
 
 
   > Make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE the default? 
   
   Yes, this is the right direction to make it user-friendly.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

wesm commented on issue #3464: ARROW-4336: Change the default BUILD_WARNING_LEVEL to CHECKIN
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3464#issuecomment-457287948
 
 
   Some of the warnings with CHECKIN mode are a bit pedantic, so even if there is no -Werror there is risk that developer-users will think that "something is wrong". I'm in favor of changing default build type to release in any case
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

fsaintjacques commented on issue #3464: ARROW-4336: [C++] Change default build type to RELEASE
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3464#issuecomment-457316890
 
 
   @wesm I think you misunderstood. In this last revision:
   
   - CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE defaults to RELEASE
   - BUILD_WARNING_LEVEL default is `PRODUCTION` if in release, otherwise defaults to `CHECKIN`.
   
   I can also remove all of this since I've separated the CHECKIN warning in a different PR.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #3464: ARROW-4336: [C++] Change default build type to RELEASE
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3464#issuecomment-457317840
 
 
   Oh I see. So the default warning level is dependent on the build type. That's fine by me
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

kou commented on issue #3464: ARROW-4336: [C++] Change default build type to RELEASE
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3464#issuecomment-457970673
 
 
   @wesm https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3505 isn't completed yet but it will help you.
   You can't use `-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=debug` for now. We need to use `-DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=release`. See 
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3503 for details.

kou commented on pull request #3464: ARROW-4336: [C++] Change default build type to RELEASE
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3464#discussion_r251606405
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -118,7 +122,7 @@ if (NOT MSVC)
   set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -fno-omit-frame-pointer")
 
   # Suppress Cython warnings
-  set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -Wno-unused-variable -Wno-maybe-uninitialized")
+  set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} -Wno-unused-variable -Wno-maybe-uninitialized -Wno-conversion")
 
 Review comment:
   This change doesn't affect MinGW build. Because it's C++ build not Python build.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.

fields.description: Default to checkin instead of production, such that it breaks early for new developers.
